@yoavgo If you're not familiar: https://t.co/GtbQ3OtCNP.
@yoavgo I think actor could still be a good model for you here, but I haven't used C++ impl (I think CAF?).
@yoavgo Beware: MPI is not exactly a programmer's delight.
@yoavgo Can bcast state-updates for variables to each machine.
@yoavgo Eh, it's been awhile. MPI is also internode MP. Still might be good, though. Run problem on N machines; each machine does 1/N work.
@yoavgo Actors might be moot bc mostly for internode message passing, but MPI is a good impl of bcast.
@yoavgo Broadcasting and actors.
@yoavgo ok, so what does "cheapest" mean? Cheapest for development? Smallest memory footprint? Easiest to bootstrap? Your soln sounds fine.
@yoavgo ideally you'd remove all mutable state and only use functional aspects -- then threads can run through your code without fear of rc
@yoavgo what does "cheapest" mean?
